intro: Ligusticum alpestre, commonly known as Alpine lovage, is a perennial herb native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided and emit a strong, spicy scent when crushed. Ligusticum alpestre is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
